--- Jason Rogers <jason.rogers@...> wrote:
>  
>     > One of the preconditions for refactoring is the existence 
>     > of a test
>     > case which is then used to verify that the refactoring 
>     > didn't break
>     > anything.  So, I claim that you should always use your 
>     > original test,
>     > and then add more if necessary.
> 
> Correction - "add more WHEN necessary".
> 
> The when is easily defined as "before" you create the other class. 
> This is
> real test first design, but you may not like that (but, why wouldn't
> you
> like it :).
> 

The "if necessary" clause applies in the case that the refactoring did
not introduce a new class.  There are many such refactorings.

Mike
